website_summaries.verdict: A well-loved, basic model with decent performance. Unbeatable price for the value.
pros: A good number of bread and crust settings
cons: Teflon-coated baking surfaces require extra care

customer_reviews.title: Since buying this machine we have not bought bread since, so much tastier!
customer_reviews.text: Since purchasing this machine we have made around 10 loaves of bread with it, 2 jams and the filling of a berry pie. the results when following the recipes are great with the exception of the orange marmalade, I think it requires way too little pectin, marmalade was runny. Added another couple of tablespoons and ran it through the jam cycle again, much better. The recipe is great though, I had home made marmalade on home made toast this morning. Sublime! After a few uses machine starts to fail. This is now on our second unit. Very dissatisfied. Review has gone from 5* to 1. I would now no longer recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Mcart

customer_reviews.title: Beware - No replacement parts available for this machine
customer_reviews.text: This machine works, but there is a serious issue with it. Even though this is an actively sold/current product, the product manufacturer (Oster) is not producing replacement parts for it. A critical part, the bread pan, is impossible to replace. Go look at Oster's website to see the write-ups on this. Oster refers pan requests to their customer support 800 line. After you call in there, you'll be informed there are no replacement pans. Net, this breadmaker becomes a piece of trash the moment that pan becomes non-functional. That does happen. To Amazon Vendor Mgt organization - You have a vendor that is knowingly and willfully creating unnecessary e-waste. What are you going to do about it?
customer_reviews.author: CandidReviewer

customer_reviews.title: total failure
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a Sunbeam bread machine, that worked perfectly for years. I gave it go a friend and bought this Oster. It has never been able to produce a loaf of bread. It mixes dough, gets warm, fails to let the dough rise, fails to bake it completely. It's not heavy enough for a boat anchor and too large for a desk top paperweight; so I can't think what it's good for. buy another brand. Maybe a nice Sunbeam.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Bisesi

customer_reviews.title: They do not stand behind their product!
customer_reviews.text: This item quit baking after 1 year of use, 1 loaf per week, and I have tried to contact Oster by E-Mail 2 times and by telephone once, Their recording said they were experiencing heave volume and too call back later and they disconnected the call. How do you get warranty work done if they do not respond to you calls or e-mails? Poor quality!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce ristau

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it! This is awesome and I am happy to have this bread maker.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Ng

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 4th use
customer_reviews.text: What a piece! I used this bread maker 4 times and it broke, it all of a sudden kept saying error. I tried to get in touch with oster customer service for over a month since it was under warranty. They never answered I tried over 9 times and the longest I waited on hold before hanging up was an hour and 45 minutes!!! I’ve also tried sending an email and no response....cool. NEVER AGAIN!!! I will never purchase another oster product
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Souza

customer_reviews.title: I am so disappointed, today I tried another recipe of theirs
customer_reviews.text: I have made many loaves of bread in this. I haven't had one finish properly. I have taken recipes out of different books, used different yeast, babysat it through the kneading process. Nothing has worked. I had a breadman machine for years and made bread every week, the pan seal broke and had to get a new machine. I am so disappointed, today I tried another recipe of theirs. I came home to a partially kneaded bread, baking. I am going to contact Oster and see if it is a flaw in my machine.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn S Schmid

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality, compared to the Oster I had for 10 yrs...It's the same model but not as sturdy and the bread pan doesn't "click" when placing it inside...My other one clicked, so I knew it was secure. This one is very tinny and thin. I even tried my old bread pan to see if it fit, but it didn't... They're really skimping on material now...It's too bad, because I loved my old one...So easy to use...I give this one maybe a year, if that long, to hold up. I'd buy another brand, but they're not as easy. I should try one though. I returned two so far, because I was expecting the inner pan to click, but it doesn't. sadly
customer_reviews.author: Milla

customer_reviews.title: Mmmm mmmm good and mmmmmmm bad
customer_reviews.text: Nothing better than fresh baked bread.... good and bad....the good... follow the instructions to the letter and you will be making great bread... the bad... Great bread, butter, another load, more butter, jelly... I ate a whole loaf and wanted more. Maybe its not bad but my wife says it is... i love it buy two because it takes 3 hrs to bake. Then you dont have to wait long for another loaf....lol..
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Perez

customer_reviews.title: Good but gone wrong...
customer_reviews.text: This item was purchased under 3 months ago. It's easy to use and almost fool-proof. The 'crust color' just seems to do that, change the color. A darker crust doesn't seem to come out any 'crustier'. However after about 20 loafs it has already gone wrong. The 'knead' paddle appears to run during the 'rise' period. Causing the loaf to collapse. It cost $30 to ship back to the manufacturer only to find the support address online is wrong. They should keep their info online up to date. Now waiting for the thing to be shipped back to me. Not impressed with the reliability of the product nor the custom support information.
customer_reviews.author: Plastic J.

customer_reviews.title: 1 out of 5 is not a winning combination
customer_reviews.text: The first loaf I made following the recipe in the instruction manual on page 18 turned out great. The next four turned out like this. Less than 6 inches high, I made damned sure I followed the instructions to the letter, exactly. I used to work as a technical documentation consultant, and I wrote manuals on high tech electronic systems, so I RTFM. (I Read The Friggin' Manual.) I have been baking bread since I was 15 years old, using a bread machine for the last 30 years. Had to replace the old unit, got this dog, (sorry, didn't mean to insult dogs), and am now returning it. Back to the drawing board.
customer_reviews.author: Keith L. Smyth

customer_reviews.title: When it works it makes nice dough or bread but most of the time it ...
customer_reviews.text: When it works it makes nice dough or bread but most of the time it simply shuts down after a few minutes failing to complete the cycle. It clearly has an electronic or software problem. The real problem is that there is ZERO customer support. When you call in you only get to "talk" to the automated system. When it switches you over to talk to a representative, it says "due to a high call volume, we cannot talk to you at this time" and hangs up. No other options offered. Over and over and over again. They clearly do not want to provide any support. Therefore, it only gets one star. I definitely would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Made my first loaf of bread today!
customer_reviews.text: I opened the package, washed the bread pan with warm soapy water, dried it, replaced it. Added instant yeast, sugar, warm water, bread flour, oil and salt and set it and forget it! It was super easy and the bread was cooked perfectly! I can't wait to experiment with different bread recipes. Especially since sometimes we can't find bread in our local grocery stores due to the pandemic. Edit: I have made two more loaves. A country white and Italian. On the Italian loaf, I used the 1 lb setting and the timer. Came out great! I am very pleased with this bread machine and its features.
customer_reviews.author: BecMac2015

customer_reviews.title: Issues and poor performance
customer_reviews.text: This product has only been used a total of 5 times since Christmas. 2 of 5 it would just shut off for no reason. The last incident is that it smoked the whole house and did not cook the bread. I am very disappointed in this product. My daughter has one and has never had an issue. I wish there was a way to return the product for safety testing. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Barclay

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw allows for grime
customer_reviews.text: We have used this for several years - the beef is decent day of - but mainly as a pizza dough maker. There is a fault in the design however and that is a divot at the top of the dough hook where liquid gets in. This also seeps down into the channel where the shaft that turns the dough hook connects to the rest of the maker. Dough ingredients seep in and sometimes pick up grime and seep back out into the dough. This part is difficult to clean and any residue gets disgusting and smells really foul. We love the pizza dough but after three or four years we are going to try a different machine.
customer_reviews.author: Sessa

customer_reviews.title: Collapses every time
customer_reviews.text: I have tried using this machine over and over for the simple beginning recipe of white bread. I still haven’t had a fully successful loaf. It collapses every time. I’ve tried making the smaller loaf size, adjusting the recipe as recommended in the manual, and I’m still not getting a good loaf. When cut, the texture on the bottom of the loaf is significantly different than the top, like it hasn’t been fully mixed or kneaded. I’ll probably be selling mine and getting a Bosch. Very disappointing purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ehofer

customer_reviews.title: Love this bread machine!
customer_reviews.text: First time I’ve ever used a bread machine. And to be honest I bought this one because it was cheapest I could find. It works great and I’ve been making multiple loaves a week because it’s so easy. The tester white loaf the book recommends was good warm with butter but it was crumbly. I was a little concerned at first. Then I tried a jalapeño cheese recipe I found online and it’s quite possibly the best bread I’ve ever had! I’ve been telling everyone I know about this machine, life changing!
customer_reviews.author: SGrudi

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: After a disastrous attempt with another brand (which leapt off the counter to its death), I welcomed this smaller machine which doesn't dance around like the other one did. No machine can compete with handmade bread, especially for whole grain varieties, but this one does as well as any I've seen. I haven't tried any of the white bread recipes as I"m a bit of a purist. It may be better for those recipes. So far my best loaf came from a King Arthur Flour recipe for whole wheat machine bread, with regular, not white, whole wheat flour. My cousin used the same recipe in her much older B&D machine and liked it as well.
customer_reviews.author: emilysgrammy

customer_reviews.title: There should be 10 stars!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this bread machine this afternoon. My first bread was from the Oster bread machine cook book, the egg bread. I didn't put salt in this bread because I am on a low sodium diet. I had been making my dough in my kitchen aid stand mixer. This inexpensive bread machine did a beautiful job of kneading and baking this wonderful sandwich bread. What a great buy this Oster is. I must add one thing that surprised me when reading the Oster bread cook book was that many recipes call for active dry yeast and not bread machine yeast. I have both yeast, but was glad to be able use the dry active yeast too.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Warehouse
customer_reviews.text: I buy ALOT of things from Amazon and this is my most disappointing purchase to date. I bought this product from Amazon warehouse but with the description- Like New. I understand that Amazon Warehouse represents minor blemish in the box/product. However this bread machine was completely marked up and the bottom part was fully corroded and had loose parts that had broke off. I am very disappointed in the warehouse’s “rigorous 20-point quality inspection.” This will be sent back. Unfortunately because it was not useable I can not speak to the actual quality of use of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Swell Flamingo

customer_reviews.title: Smells bad
customer_reviews.text: Due to allergies I wanted to bake my own bread on safer side, however As soon as received it I wanted to return it as I want to go for a bigger model. But watched few videos in YouTube and found this would be convenient and thought it will serve my purpose, I baked my first bread today though it did it’s job, my whole house smelt like melted plastic the whole day. We can’t stay inside the house due to its smell. At one point I thought it’s melting as the smell was too strong.
customer_reviews.author: Ridiculous rabbit

customer_reviews.title: Great bread makeer. Very easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying my Oster bread maker. I am on a low sodium diet. The bread you buy at the store is very high in sodium. The claim is that you cannot get yeast to rise without salt. That's not true. I make bread in my bread maker all the time with no added salt. It turns out perfectly. This machine is great. It's easy to use and cleanup is a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Circuitrider

customer_reviews.title: Descent for simple bread makers
customer_reviews.text: So I have to start out by saying I'm not a huge bread-making connoisseur. But I do love the ease of this machine. It's quite large but I think it's plain enough that it can kind of just sit on the counter in between uses. I've made several different Loaves and it doesn't adequate job. For me it makes more of a biscuit type of bread it's a little more crumbly not super soft like a Wonder Bread. Cheap little machine that does the job and allows me to make descent bread with good quality ingredients. The bread makes a better toast bread than a sandwich bread
customer_reviews.author: Devon Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great economical bread maker that anyone can learn to use
customer_reviews.text: We use it weekly for making bread. Have made standard bread, cheesy bread, spicy cheesy bread, etc. Easy to use. The only issue I could think to complain on is the digital display should be backlit, especially since standard operating area will be on a counter under overhead cabinets. can make it hard to see some of your selections so a simple backlight would improve it tremendously. It makes making bread so easy you will wonder why you weren't making your own all along.
customer_reviews.author: D Dawley

customer_reviews.title: Can't find replacement parts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago and lost the paddle. Oster stopped making the replacement part. It's a year old and they already don't have replacement parts. You're better off going with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: toolio

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Comparing Sunbeam bread maker this one will occupy smaller space, but the contain is way to small and I am afraid it can not hold 3 cups of flour. I only tried 2 cups of flour. I used Sunbeam bread maker for one year. I think the bread sunbeam makes is much better than Oster. I tried the recipe coming with the machine. It is disaster! Now I only use this bread maker for dough. So disappointed! If you want to choose the same price bread maker I wouldn't recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: orangebanana

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first bread machine I have ever owned or used and I love it. I haven't had any difficulties with it this far and I've owned it a little under a year. The recipe/manual book that comes with the machine is very useful I have made many bread loaves so far with most turning out great. I have made bread from scratch by hand and this machine saves so much time and physical exertion. I have joint pain and carpel tunnel so my arm/wrist strength is sad which is what lead me to look into a bread machine. I would recommend for a new enthusiast such as myself.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Willett

customer_reviews.title: surprisingly easy once I got the knack of taking water temperatures
customer_reviews.text: I’m a novice at baking bread of any kind but so far, using 3 different recipes in this machine, I’ve made 3 successful loaves. I know what people mean now when they say they’re going to “tweak” the recipes, so I’ll still be learning. I didn’t notice a big difference either in size or taste between the 2-lb, longer-cooking loaf and the 1.5 lb, 58-minute express loaf. Maybe just inexperience. Anyway, surprisingly easy once I got the knack of taking water temperatures, figuring out which yeast to use, instant, rapid, bread-machine or active dry, and meticulous measuring. This machine is so easy to use! The directions are very clear and easy to follow as well.
customer_reviews.author: Chickpea

customer_reviews.title: Wrong paddle for breadmaker
customer_reviews.text: The bread maker itself is great. It was delivered several days ago. The problem is that the Oster company packaged the wrong paddle. First photo is new bread pan with incorrect paddle. Second photo is new bread pan with paddle from my old Kenmore bread maker which luckily fits. I called Amazon and right away they said they would send me a new breadmaker. I may take them up on that offer but in the meantime I am trying to contact Oster for a replacement paddle. Their phones are not operating due to pandemic, so I am waiting for a response to my email. I will update this review when I hear back from Oster.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine3

customer_reviews.title: Can't Bake Bread
customer_reviews.text: The easiest explanation of what is wrong with The Oster Bread Machine can be told by the fact that after 15 loaves baked, none of them came out right. The proof is my daughter, who has a Panasonic and lives two blocks away, and I used the exact same recipe; her bread was perfect and my Oster bread is a disaster as always. I missed the Amazon return by a couple of weeks, because I thought it would straighten out. DO NOT BUY OSTER Ted Hart Rancho Murieta, CA
customer_reviews.author: Harry Tedrow

customer_reviews.title: bread wont rise
customer_reviews.text: bread wont rise. we got this only less than 6 months ago. it worked OK at first, but for the last few wks bread just wont rise. we checked to see if the lid was loose or if we did the recipe wrong... but nothing the machine looks ok, we tried different recipes and it just won't work right... very desapointed. will contact manufacturer to see if they can fix it or replace it. will change ratings if appropriate... but for now, I cannot recommend the machine. the price is good, but I think it should last more than 6 months....
customer_reviews.author: Menchu

customer_reviews.title: Makes good bread
customer_reviews.text: We love this bread maker in my house. Price was right. Tinkering with recipe a bit and we have it down. Lots of different options. Paddle in bottom sometimes a bit challenging to remove but we can't think of any better solution. Occasionally flour doesn't mix entirely into the loaf and a bit is left on the edge of pan or loaf. We can't figure out the variable so have just learned to live with the mystery. We make bread by weighing additions so results are fairly consistent. Still not as consistent as baking in oven, but the convenience makes it well worth using this. We have probably made 25 loaves - no problem so far. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: better than expect machine and results
customer_reviews.text: better than expected. I had 1 loaf in the machine from start to finish but was not thrilled with the cube shape of the bread. Since then I have made more than a dozen bread items, from cinnamon rolls, braided cheddar bacon jalapeno bread, Hawaiian rolls, honey wheat bread, and plain yeast rolls. Loving the results.
customer_reviews.author: Liesa

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic breadmaker
customer_reviews.text: This is my first-ever breadmaker. I wasn't sure how much I'd use it, but I've entirely stopped buying bread and use the machine at least every other day. I've been particularly impressed by how sturdy it is -- it fell on the floor once, and the lid detached seamlessly and was reattached seamlessly. I've been using King Arthur's dark flour recipe (replacing parts of the flour with steel cut oats and cut almonds, adding some dried cranberries, and using honey instead of sugar), and the bread is absolutely delicious -- I eat the crispy ends right away no matter how hungry I am.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Bread doesn't rise.
customer_reviews.text: I've had 4 of these machines. The first one lasted about 2 years. The 2nd didn't last a year. The third didn't work at all, (bread wouldn't rise) and the replacement machine I received was as bad as the one I returned. Won't buy another!
customer_reviews.author: Fluff

customer_reviews.title: Makes Bread...
customer_reviews.text: I am currently in the process of baking my third loaf of bread. The first 2 loaves were awesome, we'll have to wait a few hoursfor the results on the third loaf! The only "bread" I've ever made before this machine was banana nut and zucchini bread...I have never made "real" bread the "traditional " way. With that said, this was easy to use even for the novice user. There is always a slight learning curve, but this is an affordable, easy to use machine.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Kaffenberger

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My 1st bread machine was an Oster, and it was great - worked well for years. I expected the same quality in this machine, but not so. I have also had 2 other bread machines of a different brand, and they were likewise just great! I have not had one satisfactory loaf of bread from this last Oster. Also, the pan does not "snap" in place, and it is very difficult to know when it is properly seated or not. Maybe this was a lemon?? I have had several good products from Oster, but this particular machine is certainly not one.
customer_reviews.author: VAL

customer_reviews.title: Then I decided to make it easy on myself and I'm so glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I spent months baking bread on my own just to teach myself. Then I decided to make it easy on myself and I'm so glad I did. This lil contraption is amazing. I followed the instructions and sat back and enjoyed the wonderful smell from the kitchen. My very first load came out perfect. The book came with a few recipies, let me tell you the Italian Herb Bread is mouth watering.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Fresh Bread Everyday!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after making bread by hand for years. Great time saver and it makes great bread! It gets used just about daily in our house. One tip - don't walk away from it while it's kneading. It does move around on the counter and it could dance its way onto the floor if not attended. Otherwise, great addition to my kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: R.B.

customer_reviews.title: Just don't
customer_reviews.text: How does this thing get high marks? You basically have to make 20 loaves before you figure out the water and yeast ratio that accommodates bad quality and manufacturing. I'm up to 10 loaves already, every one has fallen and failed. I've made accommodations re; amt of yeast, water, even changed the brand of flour, yeast I used but still deflating failed loaves. By the time you've bought everything and tested the bread maker any sense of savings you were hoping for is lost. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: L. Dah

customer_reviews.title: BAD PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I GET A BIG LEMON. I BOUGHT IT FOR THE GOOD PRICE AND GOOD FEEDBACKS. AFTER THE LAST PERIOD OF RISE, THE MACHINE KNEADED THE DOUGH, SO ALL THE AIR IN YOUR DOUGH IS JUST OUT, AS A RESULT YOU GET A DRY AND HARD COMPACT BREAD. SO I HAVE TO BE PENDING ALL THE TIME, TO REMOVE THE CONTAINER WITH THE DOUGH BEFORE THAT HAPPEN, WHEN THE BAKING TIME BEGINS PLACE IT BACK IN ITS PLACE TO BE ABLE TO GET GOOD RESULTS. THIS BREAD MACHINE IS A NIGHTMARE. I HATE THAT PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: gio

customer_reviews.title: Teflon material is peeling off in two places inside the pan.
customer_reviews.text: We've only had this bread-maker for 4 months and used it only about 10 times. Despite the basic functionality of the bread maker being more than satisfactory, the teflon material is peeling off in two large places inside the pan. It is a health hazard. Reviews from several years ago did not report teflon delamination problems. Has the pan design been changed employing thinner material to save cost? Regardless, we will no longer use this bread maker and will seek a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: The best bread machine! I’ve had it since 2012!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best bread maker out there! I’ve had a few, and I make bread 2 times a week and sometimes a pizza dough on Fridays as well. I love my machine and I’ve had it since August 2012!! I can’t imagine our lives without it. All recipes in the book are wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: PPSL

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste money
customer_reviews.text: Bought it August 7th. Had it for 3mos now. At the beginning everything was fine. Found the bread recipe that worked perfect! But that was only for a little over than a month. For the last month I've been trying to bake the bread so many times,so much ingredients wasted and it doesn't work :/. The dough never rises as it should ,no matter if I add 3tbs of yeast. Tried everything. Also the lid comes off easily,which is a hassle. Pretty sure the matter is in the breadmaker. Money wasted :((
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING!!!! We use this weekly. All the great reviews are correct; this is an excellent bread maker. We make pizza dough, flat breads, quick breads as well as excellent white bread. It saves money and gives us healthy choices. It's easy to use and we've used its many, many times since Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Abby84

customer_reviews.title: Great machine but....
customer_reviews.text: This machine is excellent and amazing. I've had it over a year using it at least 3 times a week and the machine itself works great. I'm giving only 2 stars because the piece holding the rod that holds the blade in the pan disintegrated and now the rod falls out. Finding replacement parts is very difficult. I would like to buy a new pan but I've been unable to find one so I'm going to have to try to find the parts I need and hope I can get it to work. Without the pan, the machine is useless.
customer_reviews.author: IF

customer_reviews.title: Not So Good but Could be Recipe!
customer_reviews.text: Had horrific results from one of the owner's manuals basic recipes, that is 100% whole wheat. I was ready to send this back but thought better and tried a second basic recipe it was as expected. Only reason I ordered this thing was to get 100% Whole Wheat Bread!!! Now I have to scour the internet to try and find a recipe that doesn't look and taste like a tumor growing on something!
customer_reviews.author: Roger Fox

customer_reviews.title: Best Bread Maker
customer_reviews.text: Who needs to buy bread when you have a bread machine to make fresh bread. I love this machine. I haven't bought bread in almost two years. It is super easy to make. I love the recipes it comes with. Make sure you keep the machine close to the wall if on the counter because it does move a little. It is easy to clean. It was a great addition to our kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M.

customer_reviews.title: Best bread machine under $100
customer_reviews.text: After using this little machine to bake three different loaves of absolute perfection, I have to say that this is the absolute best bread machine under $100. Interface is simple, settings are easy to understand, and it makes great breads. Despite the simplicity, it's quite flexible. Allows for different loaf sizes, crust darkness, different presets for different types of bread, and delay timer for when you want to wake up to fresh bread. Next: bagel dough.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I decided to start baking our own bread. Ordered one of these based on a variety of reviews. Was finally able to buy some flour over the weekend and last night we put it to the test, making the french country loaf. The recipe was easy to follow and the bread came out nice - good crust, great texture. Looking forward to making a lot more bread with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: rick m

customer_reviews.title: Works well, not sure how to get bread to taste fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if it’s me or the bread maker, but as I’m just hearing to bake bread with this machine, I can’t tell. All of the loaves are a little dry and crumbly. The ingredients mix well, the proofing works great. The loaf fills the pan. I’ve been using the medium crust however I think the darker crust selection might be better, as it’s still quite light.
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: Homemade bread!!  Yum!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first bread maker I've ever used. The hardest part about using this bread maker is planning ahead and getting the ingredients together for the bread I want. The first bread I made had a funky texture - I ultimately was able to pinpoint the wheat gluten I added into the recipe (per the guidance of a breadmaker recipe book) as the problem. When I removed the unnecessary wheat gluten, the bread was perfect. My son: "Make it exactly like this every time and you'll be known for great bread." I hope to find time to explore other kinds of bread and come up with some awesome breads we've never had before!
customer_reviews.author: P. J. Scott

customer_reviews.title: outcome not persistant
customer_reviews.text: its easy to use, timer function as designed, and very easy to clean. however above those things the outcome is not persistant, wife uses the same recipe and the result is quite diffrent. sometimes its perfect bread and other times its just half baked. i think its internal heating coil is not well functioning, just guessing.
customer_reviews.author: squid wagner

customer_reviews.title: I've been using Oster 1-2 times a week for 3 months and it is still working good. Very easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: I paid $43.19 for this item, really cheap. Light weight compares to my Panasonic which I paid $300 but burnt in a year. I've been using Oster 1-2 times a week for 3 months and it is still working good. Very easy to operate. The timer is very helpful and the loaf was ready at the exact time. The instruction book is simple to understand. Recipes included, but I'm addicted to the Italian bread, taste yummy and the crust is not thick. I made some for my friends and everyone gave it a thumb up. It does not have a nuts compartment, but it beeps when I can add nuts. A good bread maker.
customer_reviews.author: Christina L

customer_reviews.title: I love this bread machine
customer_reviews.text: My husband was worried that this would be one of those "buy it but never use it" but I use it once a week. I have even created a few new recipes & got a sourdough starter going. I love my bread machine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It worked well for 8 months. And then it just stopped.
customer_reviews.text: I got this bread maker 8 months ago and I have been using it on a regular basis to make bread and pizza dough. For no reason whatsoever the machine stop working. It doesnt kneed and it doesnt bake and I hate it that I have to start calling people to figure out what will happen with it.
customer_reviews.author: Terrible Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a nice bread maker
customer_reviews.text: I was a bread making noob and didn't want to drop hundreds of dollars on a super fancy bread maker, so I chose this one. I've made about 8 loaves over the past few months using a few of the recipes in the included booklet (basic white, french, italian herb -- all 2 lb loaves with a medium crust). They all turned out great. It's easy to use and easy to clean. No complaints. I think it's a great value.
customer_reviews.author: jyw

customer_reviews.title: Delicious bread, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying baking bread. I tried several different recipes from the book that came with it and from online. I am especially enjoying sourdough oatmeal bread. The basic breads; white, wheat, oatmeal, sourdough work best. I tried several variations with add-ins like cheese and herb or cinnamon raisin, but they didn't rise as well and tended to be too crumbly to slice easily.
customer_reviews.author: Tsarat

customer_reviews.title: This is a piece of CRAP!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used my Oster breadmaker maybe 6 times and it just QUIT! The digital readout says it is on DOUGH cycle and I am unable do ANYTHING. It won't turn on. I have unplugged it...plugged it back in...banged on it to get it to do SOMETHING...ANYTHING but it just sits there and looks at me! I had a bread maker for about 20 years and LOVED it. but alas it finally died on me. I thought that this Oster would replace it! Yeah! Right! It is a piece of CRAP!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nana Nanny

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product, Takes a minute of learning curve to ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Product, Takes a minute of learning curve to make bread comparable to bread you by at the store. Would recommend if you are interested or want a dependable bread machine. Also comes with a great recipe book. The wife and i really enjoy making loaf in the morning for dinner later that day. For those with Issues with the problems of not rising enough. Remember to make sure your yeast is room temperature and you can replace some 3 tablespoons of your flour with vital wheat gluten.
customer_reviews.author: Keaton

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: My old bread machine from the 90's died and I bought this as a replacement. I have been very happy with it so far. It's much lighter than my old one and smaller so it makes pulling it out of storage much easier. It mixes, proofs and bakes faster as well. I've done maybe 5 loaves with it so far and once it gave me trouble when it reset after mixing. I'm not sure why unless I had a small flicker of power outage. It's been making bread normally after that hiccup.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: .Smells wonderful and very cheap a 5# bag of flour make 4 huge loafs of great healthy
customer_reviews.text: I was going to return this but changed my mine .sooooo easy to use I make rainis and white and follow recipe to the letter .It come out perfect .I made the mistake of making the roll recipe dinner and the cinnamon rolls now everyone wants me to bring anytime we have a family dinner grandma these are wonderful
customer_reviews.author: Rainey

customer_reviews.title: It might just be me.
customer_reviews.text: It was easy enough to follow the instructions, and easy enough to clean. But, no matter how precisely I measured everything, every single loaf of bread I made was like a brick. Just dense and hard and horrible. BRICK. I gave it away. I wouldn't buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Declicous Toast!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the first time this week and I am very happy with it. It is a pretty exact process from what I understand but we followed the directions to a T and basic white bread came out great. It was a lot of fun looking through the porthole on top of the unit and watching it do its thing. It's a pretty involved automated process and after 3 hours I had a midnight snack of freshly baked bread and toast. I will be trying many more of these recipes in the future as the manual came with a ton of them!
customer_reviews.author: NaNa Na NaNa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This breadmaker makes a great, large loaf. It cooks evenly and comes out in a nice loaf shape. The only drawback is that the beater bar does sometimes stick in the bottom of the loaf when it comes out after baking. You need to wiggle it a bit to get it out of the bread. It does not affect the taste but then there is a weird hole in the bottom. I think this likely happens with any machine. This is a great price and was exactly what we needed to bake bread. We love to set the timer for a fresh loaf in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Katy Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Making bread can be a real pain. Bread machines take the work out of bread making. The Oster is a great little beginner machine at a good price. But there are some drawbacks: The paddle can get buried in the bread -- but it is easy to remove. And it makes a little hole in the bottom where the paddle is -- the thing that kneads the dough. The Oster will not give you those European crusty breads -- no bread machine will. The good news is that if crusty breads are your thing, you can remove the dough before the baking process kicks in and bake the bread in the oven. I have done that. Results were great!
customer_reviews.author: HARDINACK R.

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: I hate to write a review about a product when I haven't been able to actually use it, but that's kind of the big problem here. If a product comes broken, it's a quality control issue. It seems like this happens more than it should with this specific bread maker. That's not ok and it deserves a lower score.
customer_reviews.author: The Grand Coffee House

customer_reviews.title: Awesome maker!
customer_reviews.text: I love this beard maker! I have had it for awhile now and have used it at least once a week and it works just like the day I got it! I would really recommend this maker for someone who was like me, not super sure if beard making at home was really going to work out but was pleasantly surprised when it did. I really like this machine!
customer_reviews.author: Renata Andrejszky

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Machine
customer_reviews.text: As a bachelor that doesn't cook often I find this machine to be very, very convenient. It takes less than 5 minutes to prep this and set it to cook, check on it once to make sure the dough is right, then walk away. Works well every time, especially with premade bread mixes. I always have fresh bread available as a result, which my GF loves when she visits.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: 1 year update
customer_reviews.text: Update after 1 year: Motor coil is burned after a year that we buy this machine (April 2015). We noticed it with a burnt plastic smell. Since we buy the machine, we only make 100% whole wheat bread. We used it once in a week or every other week. All loafs came out consistently good so far, but we totally disappointed with the motor coil burn. I would say it is probably OK for the money but I won't buy it again, as I'm looking for durable stuff. The biggest disadvantage is the fact that almost all parts surrounded by plastic, I'm not sure whether this fact has anything to do with the burn.
customer_reviews.author: Gul Zerze

customer_reviews.title: took at least 7 tries and 4 different recipes to get a decent tasting bread
customer_reviews.text: followed the directions to the T, very dense bread. tried the trouble shooting still dense and top caves in, tried my sister in laws directions and little better, top still caves in. finally did a couple adjustments on my own and bread tasted good but still caved in. not real happy with outcome.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline L. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t be happier
customer_reviews.text: I had an old Breadmaker that finally died so I chose this one to replace it as the recommendations were very high. I am not disappointed. It is easy to use, much quieter and very easy to clean. In addition it is larger and much lighter in weight but stayed in place while in use. So far I’ve only used it to make dough but my bread turned out delicious. I’m very happy with this breadmaker.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne E. Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Can't even try it out!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot remove the bread pan. Ive tried several times. I've had friends try. I looked up tutorials on YouTube for how to get it out. It does not come out. Period. I havent even been able to set it up completely, let alone ever try to use it. It was so hard to even get it out of the box that the packaging was completely destroyed in the unboxing process so I cant even return it without it being an even bigger hassle than returns are to begin with. I have never been more disappointed or felt like I've completely wasted money as much as this. All I wanted was to smell fresh baked bread. Awful, horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha Williams

customer_reviews.title: Good machine.
customer_reviews.text: It can make 1lb, 1&1/2 lb, and 2 lb loaves. I took a chance getting this machine because I could find no information that it could make a small one pound loaf. Would love to give this item 5 stars but I have to use a flashlight to read the digital screen (it's not back lit) and the lid comes unhinged too easily when I take the basket out or close it.
customer_reviews.author: Leveret

customer_reviews.title: Bread of my dreams
customer_reviews.text: I love this bread maker! I've been preparing fresh whole grain breads with seeds and dry fruits, with the benefit of having no preservatives or other chemicals in my bread. The bread maker is very easy to use: just add the ingredients, setup the kind of bread to be prepared and the machine will do its part. The bread maker also gives you the estimates the time for the bread to be ready. I also successfully tried the function to setup the timer for the bread maker to prepare the bread late in the night and when I woke up I experienced a fresh, warm and toasty bread. A good quality of life improvement.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Oster  bread machine
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for my daughter. She is very happy with this machine. She has made many different loaves and all came out perfect. See photo she sent me.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma W

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Machine and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: We are delighted with this machine! We were first-time-ever users of any bread machine, and using the info we learned from reading The Bread Lover's Bread Machine Cookbook, we were able to adapt an old family bread recipe. The FIRST loaf was perfect! The settings are easy to see, and we highly recommend this machine to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: K. T. Young

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing oddly shaped loaf.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second bread machine for me. I had a different brand for many years that made good loaves. It quit working so I bought this one. It said it was a good machine without a lot of bells and whistles. I only wanted it to make a good basic white loaf. I followed a recipe in the book that came with it. It didn’t have a good grain or texture. The finished loaf is an odd shape. I would recommend paying more for a higher quality machine.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Lady

customer_reviews.title: disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this based on a positive experience with a large rectangle Oster that is almost 20 years old that recently stopped working. solid machine. Was looking forward to this smaller more compact version. This one does not live up to the quality of the old. The pan is very light, dough spilled out over the top during mixing (I followed recipe), the machine moved on the counter during mixing and the noises from the mix/beeps were really loud. Did not feel safe setting and forgetting this one. Will certainly consider brand but a higher end - better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dazy

customer_reviews.title: Machine is awesome. Bread tastes great. but it sinks
customer_reviews.text: I give up. I got this bread machine for the office so I can start the process in the morning and by lunch we would have fresh baked bread for lunch. I haven't bought a loaf of bread from the store in three months. Except, I have a problem. Every loaf Sinks sometime in the last 20 minutes of baking. I tried it. A 2nd person tried the machine(their bread sinks). A friend got the exact same bread maker like mine. He tried the same bread at his house. It Sinks. I am getting so frustrated!
customer_reviews.author: VegasNative

customer_reviews.title: The Dough Cycle is Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine to use as a dough maker, cycle 9, and it kneads and allows the dough to rise perfectly. It's a lot better and cheaper than a mixer with a dough hook. I then take the dough out and bake it in my conventional oven. It's not that much work! A quality bread maker per se, ahhhhh, I think not. However, in this day and age you aren't going to get perfect bread for $69. I'm not sure how long it's going to last but I plan to make a 1.5 lb. loaf every 4th day. I'll advise if the appliance goes south.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE fancy breads but refuse to pay for them
customer_reviews.text: I have never made a real loaf of bread from scratch. I love this thing. I've made sourdough and a sweet bread so far and they both came out perfect. It tells you exactly what step it's on and how much longer til your bread is done. The alarm for add ins is the perfect volume to definitely alert you from across the house, without deafening you if you're nearby. Read the instruction manual that comes with it. It covers many possible problems and provides a good base of bread recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Rhiannon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and affordable!
customer_reviews.text: I have been making bread every weekend with this. It's so easy to use and so easy to clean. The bread pan is non-stick and wipes clean so easily. I live at a high elevation of 6,060 feet so at first my bread would rise perfectly and as soon as it started to bake the top would fall. I finally figured to increase the amount of salt by 25% and decrease the amount of yeast by 50% and when it calls for warm water to use just cool water and now my bread is perfect every time.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Does its job quietly and efficiently.  What else is there for a tool.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly first time and everytime so far. I've only made the 1.5lb express bread recipe but it's great and I get a loaf in a little over an hour prep time included in the 58mins machine time. Arrived timely in professional manufacturer's box. Instructions easy to read. The oothing missing. Works quietly and I like the compactness of it. I won't use the options much but my wife may when she gets back from her trip. I'll try to update the bread maker over time but I'm very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T

customer_reviews.title: This machine does handle gluten free bread mixes
customer_reviews.text: This machine works faster than my old machine and does a good job. While there is no "Gluten Free Breadmix" choice, per se, if you press the crust setting a few times and select the 2 hour 17 minute time, that works beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Bread!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing bread machine !! I only used it once so far but the loaf was gone in about 5 min! Between my husband and two kids we managed to finish the entire loaf of bread and I am currently making my 2nd loaf! I used the recipe the machine came with and it was delicious and real easy. The best past is that there is very minimal cleanup. The loaf of bread slides right out and leaves very little to clean up. I hope this machine lasts so that we can make many many more loaves of bread! Thank you Oster !!!!
customer_reviews.author: S Grossman

customer_reviews.title: Recommend! And updated with Pic
customer_reviews.text: Update May 2018. Two years later and we’re still going strong. Such a smart investment for our family. Added pics! This is our first bread maker and I could not be happier with this purchase. It comes with recipes that we've already done 3 of as well as very easy to set up and use. Easy cleanup. Bought a bread maker to be able to control what ingredients we use as my youngest has food allergies. This has allowed for more variety in her already restricted diet. All you have to do is pick a recipe and throw the ingredients in. The bread maker does the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Mama3x

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Lasted one year. Bread does not cook thoroughly or rise to desired level. I've tried different yeast but still doesn't rise or cook. To view settings on the screen, one has to have the right lighting and be right on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: Aquanaut

customer_reviews.title: Nice breadmaker with a few issues...
customer_reviews.text: This maker is a nice little product, but it's not without its issues. First things first though: the bread made from the booklet's basic recipe is DELICIOUS. The biggest problem is that it's is VERY hard to get consistent results from it. Most times the bread rises too much, but occasionally the bread doesn't rise at all. It's a pain, but it makes such good bread most of the time that aside from the odd deflated look to the loaf, it's worth the money. Might not buy it again, but if you want a basic, affordable maker and are willing to deal with the issues, it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kacey P.

customer_reviews.title: A variety of breads await with this bread maker
customer_reviews.text: This is my first bread maker and I think it's great! It's easy to make bread and the recipe booklet that comes with it has good recipes, too. My only gripe is that the stirring attachment is hard to clean and gets stuck in the bottom of the loaf, but that in and of itself is very minor. I highly recommend this bread maker.
customer_reviews.author: Moxie_2011

customer_reviews.title: ... purchased this bread maker in July and I was satisfied with the quality of the bread it produced
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bread maker in July and I was satisfied with the quality of the bread it produced. In September, after about eight loves, it stopped working (loud humming and shut off during the baking cycle). I was disappointed that it failed after only a few loves, so I called service and after a short conversation the representative offered to ship a new bread maker at no charge. Very impressive customer service. I hope the next one holds up better. I can’t comment on the overall quality of the machine, but given the response of customer service I would feel confident purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: H. Vogl

customer_reviews.title: Solid product for the price point
customer_reviews.text: This is a good entry level bread maker for people with little to no experience or people who only make bread seldom. One serious tip though; this bread maker can move a fair bit during the kneading process which may cause it to fall off of your counter. To counteract this I had to place it in the sink. Not a big deal, but it would have been quite a sad day to come home to a busted bread maker and a mess on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Carter Osborne

customer_reviews.title: I have used it several times and the bread bakes beautifully. I didn't realize how bad my old machine ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bread machine because my old died. I based my decision on the features it has and I read all the reviews. I have used it several times and the bread bakes beautifully. I didn't realize how bad my old machine was until I used this one. It is very easy to use. I would recommend to be careful of the lid when it is open. Just don't lift it by the lid or throw it open. Overall I highly recommend this machine if you are looking for a great value. so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: sewamania

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how I lived without this. So easy to use. If this item broke I would order the exact one the same day.
customer_reviews.author: Livius Nedin

customer_reviews.title: better condition than expected
customer_reviews.text: This was a Warehouse product that was listed as "Acceptable". I was trying to ascertain what that meant through some internet research and it appeared to be all over the map. I crossed my fingers and hoped for the best. The bread machine appears to be in fine working order, and have yet to find much in the way of dings, but it was missing the box and manual. Unless something that I haven't tested doesn't work, I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: wileecoyote

customer_reviews.title: I need a replacement kneading blade
customer_reviews.text: Nice bread machine. However, the only negative thing is that the kneading blade is movable. It happened to me to misplace it and now the machine is practically unusable. I don't know how to contact the company in order to ask for a replacement. If any of the company members reads my review, please contact me. I need a replacement kneading blade ASAP, so I will be able to use it again. Otherwise, I will have to replace the whole bread machine, which is expensive. If I have news, I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Dimosthenis Paraskevaidis

customer_reviews.title: A Useful machine for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for making bread dough for me(for the kitchen Aid is too expensive). But its rectangle shape made the mixer low efficiency in making a dough, I need 2 mix cycles to make a bread dough. Except this, it works well. But I haven’t used it to make a bread automatically, for I have a lot of failure experiences in my former bread machine. I used the dough it made, and divided it into parts, and made some shapes I like and put it into oven to ferment, then baked, and last I got the good breads I want.
customer_reviews.author: Lv_baby

customer_reviews.title: Bread A slice of life
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful bread maker. It is the second of this type I have bought. Try homemade bread and you will be hooked for life. This machine is the reason I could never do keto
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warning! Will cause you to fill up on carbs!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my girlfriend for Christmas last year, and I have gained about 20 pounds since. But man, this machine makes some darn good bread. Takes no baking talent at all. Simply add the ingredients and press start. Not to steal a trademark motto or anything but, 'set it and forget it' is truly all it takes. Smells the house up like fresh bread too. Always a hit at holiday dinner parties when you bring a freshly made loaf of bread. Nothing but praise for this breadmaker. No complaints other than my weight gain, but I can't blame Oster for that I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I just started making my own bread to cut out the junk that's in store bought breads and I really love this machine. I've made regular sandwich bread and a couple sweet breads. It's easy to clear and makes loaves of either 1 lb, 1.5 lb or 2 lbs. I have not used the express settings but the others settings are very easy to use. Comes with a cookbook but I noted there was a cookbook I could purchase to with it. Easy to use! I liked it so much and so did my mom so I bought her one too.
customer_reviews.author: jmpaugh

product_meta.title: Oster Bread Maker | Expressbake, 2-Pound Loaf
product_meta.description: Color:White/IvoryWake up to the aroma of freshly baked bread with the Oster Express bake Bread Machine. Designed to make up to a 2 pound family sized loaf, this bread maker comes with its own tested recipes for ultimate perfection. The bread machine features multiple settings that offer ideal baking versatility and a Delay Bake timer that lets you set the baking time up to 13 hours in advance. An Express Bake cycle bakes delicious bread in under an hour. A large LCD display allows you to easily navigate the settings, and a clear window on the top lets you peek inside to see the bread as it bakes. For added convenience, this bread maker comes with a measuring cup, a spoon, and a kneading paddle. The sleek design with White/Ivory finish effortlessly matches any kitchen décor, making the Oster Express bake Bread Machine a great housewarming or wedding gift.
feature_bullets: 650 watts oster bread maker with upto a 2.0 pound loaf capacity is ideal for larger families
12 bread settings and 3 crust settings for making a variety of breads, dough, and jams
Expressbake setting bakes bread in under an hour
13 hour programmable baking timer for fresh bread anytime
Large LCD display and intuitive button controls for easy operation; 40 inch cord length

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars5,358 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
